pr_title: Dynamic accelerator framework - Annotation for accelerator

timeline.bodyText:
Use the javadoc style for writing doc for public method:
/**
 * Description
 * @return 
 */
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: Don't use super generic method name unless this method is really that generic. This method is more like getAnnotationValues?
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText:
A more idiomatic way to use stream (or functional style in general) is to only do one thing per function, since that layout the logic better.
Arrays.stream(fields)
  .map(String::trim)
  .map(String::toLowerCase) 
  .filter(Object::nonNull)
  .filter(s -> !s.isEmpty())
  .collect(Collectors.toSet());
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: This method actually returns the Requirements class, not the annotation, so better call it getArtifactRequirements()
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.message: (CDAP-17270) Add accelerators to Requirements annotation. Enable Requirements annotation for ApplicationClass.
(CDAP-17270) Add accelerators to Requirements annotation. Enable Requirements annotation for ApplicationClass.
